metadata.title: CVE-2020-12059 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Ceph through 13.2.9. A POST request with aninvalid tagging XML can crash the RGW process by triggering a NULL pointerexception.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-base - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-common - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-fuse - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-mds - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-mgr - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-mon - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-osd - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-resource-agents - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
ceph-test - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libcephfs-java - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libcephfs-jni - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libcephfs2 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
librados2 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4

librgw2 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python-ceph - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python-cephfs - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python-rados - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python-rbd - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4

python3-ceph-argparse - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python3-cephfs - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python3-rados - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python3-rbd - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
python3-rgw - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
radosgw - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
rbd-fuse - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4

No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.4').
